question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
If \[\frac{x}{y} = \frac{4}{5}, \; \frac{y}{z} = \frac{3}{10}, \;\text{and} \; \frac{z}{w} = \frac{6}{7},\] what is the value of $\dfrac{x + y + w}{z}$? Express your answer as a common fraction.
inference:
Given
$$\frac{x}{y} = \frac{4}{5}, \; \frac{y}{z} = \frac{3}{10}, \;\text{and} \; \frac{z}{w} = \frac{6}{7}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x}{y} \times \frac{y}{z} \times \frac{z}{w} = \frac{4}{5} \times \frac{3}{10} \times \frac{6}{7}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x}{w} = \frac{72}{350}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x + y + w}{z} = \frac{x}{z} + \frac{y}{z} + \frac{w}{z}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x + y + w}{z} = \frac{x}{w} \times \frac{w}{z} + \frac{y}{z} + \frac{w}{z}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x + y + w}{z} = \frac{72}{350} + \frac{3}{10} + \frac{6}{7}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x + y + w}{z} = \frac{72 + 105 + 300}{350}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x + y + w}{z} = \frac{477}{350}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x + y + w}{z} = \boxed{\frac{477}{350}} \times \frac{10}{10}$$
$$\Rightarrow \frac{x + y + w}{z} = \boxed{\frac{4770}{3500}}$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{4770}{3500}}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
If we multiply the first two fractions, we can find the value of $x/z$: $$\frac{x}{y}\cdot\frac{y}{z}=\frac{x}{z}=\frac{4}{5}\cdot\frac{3}{10}=\frac{12}{50}.$$

Inverting the given $\dfrac{z}{w} = \dfrac{6}{7}$ gives $$\frac{w}{z}=\frac{7}{6}.$$

Adding these results to the given value of $y/z$ gives the value we are looking for: \begin{align*}
\frac{x}{z}+\frac{y}{z}+\frac{w}{z}&=\frac{x+y+w}{z} \\&= \frac{12}{50}+\frac{7}{6}+\frac{3}{10}\\
& = \frac{36}{150}+\frac{175}{150}+\frac{45}{150}\\
& = \frac{256}{150} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{128}{75}}.\end{align*}

ground_truth:
If we multiply the first two fractions, we can find the value of $x/z$: $$\frac{x}{y}\cdot\frac{y}{z}=\frac{x}{z}=\frac{4}{5}\cdot\frac{3}{10}=\frac{12}{50}.$$

Inverting the given $\dfrac{z}{w} = \dfrac{6}{7}$ gives $$\frac{w}{z}=\frac{7}{6}.$$

Adding these results to the given value of $y/z$ gives the value we are looking for: \begin{align*}
\frac{x}{z}+\frac{y}{z}+\frac{w}{z}&=\frac{x+y+w}{z} \\&= \frac{12}{50}+\frac{7}{6}+\frac{3}{10}\\
& = \frac{36}{150}+\frac{175}{150}+\frac{45}{150}\\
& = \frac{256}{150} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{128}{75}}.\end{align*}
